lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Dude.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Dude.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
// initialize the buffered reader to take input from the console
private static final BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));
// initialize the command processor from logic processing, use the commandParse to process the console input
private static final TaskDao taskDao = new TaskDaoImpl();
private static final ICommandLogicUnit commandLogicUnit = new CommandLogicUnitImpl(taskDao);
private static final ICommandProcessor commandProcessor = new CommandProcessorImpl(commandLogicUnit);
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
" What can I do for you?");
* Logic class that would handle all the logics and processing, together with the temporary data layer of the commands
// temporarily, the database is stored within dao, hence no need for DI
* command processing functions, in this implementation it accepts all the commands
* @param command   one of the command from Command enum class
* @param arguments corresponding arguments for each command
public void processCommand(Command command, Map<String, String> arguments) {
printSentence(" Got it. I've added this task: \n" +
" Now you have " + taskDao.size() + " tasks in the list.");
printSentence("Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n" +
printSentence(" Noted. I've removed this task: \n" +
" Now you have " + taskDao.size() + " tasks in the list.");
printSentence(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* print the entire list of tasks whether its done or not done
* An entity that takes in the input from the console and parse it to valid command or throw exception
if (byIndex == -1) throw new IllegalArgumentException("/by command not found");
if (desc.isBlank()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("deadline desc cannot be empty");
if (timing.isBlank()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("deadline timing cannot be empty");
if (desc.isBlank()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("todo desc cannot be empty");
if (byIndex == -1) throw new IllegalArgumentException("/at command not found");
if (desc.isBlank()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("event desc cannot be empty");
if (timing.isBlank()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("event timing cannot be empty");
processException(new IllegalCallerException("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-("));
* Interface for the central processing unit of the commands that contain the logic and data layer
* function that takes a valid command from the model and the corresponding arguments (that are assumed to be correct already)
* @param command   one of the command from Command enum class
* @param arguments corresponding arguments for each command
void processCommand(Command command, Map<String, String> arguments);
* Command line processor interface that takes in the input from the console
* Parse the input from console into corresponding command and process it, current implementation using Command Processor
* Data access object (dao) for the Task model
* add a task to the data layer, throw error instead of Optional if add fails
* @param index as it appears in the list - 1 (from 1 indexing to 0 indexing)
* @param index as it appears in the list - 1 (from 1 indexing to 0 indexing)
* @param index as it appears in the list - 1 (from 1 indexing to 0 indexing)
* @return list of all of done and not done tasks
* Implementation of the TaskDao using the temporary storage of ArrayList for database
// ArrayList is working as a database for now
private final ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<>();
throw new IllegalArgumentException("non valid index for deletion");
throw new IllegalArgumentException("non valid index for marking the task done");
throw new IllegalArgumentException("non valid index for marking the task done");
* list of commands available for the logic unit
*      BYE : to end the chat, no arguments requires, any extra arguments would be ignored, invoked using "bye"
*      LIST : list the entire tasks array
*     Adding a Task: divided into 3 smaller parts :
*       DEADLINE : add a new deadline, takes 3 arguments section: description, \by, deadline
*     EVENT : add a new deadline, takes 3 arguments section: description, \at, deadline
*        TODOS : add a new deadline, takes 1 argument : description
*      DONE : mark the task as done, 1 argument is required which is the number of task (the rest is ignored)
*      INVALID : any other commands other than bye, the whole sentence would be echoed back instead
* a task containing description and the deadline of the task
* String representation of deadline, marked with [D], desc and the deadline
* a task containing description and the time of the event
* @param time string representing the time of the event
* String representation of Event, marked with [E], desc and the timing
* abstract class of task that represents a thing to be done
* constructor of the abstract class, to be initialized with the subclass
* get the status of the task
* @return boolean representing whether the task is done
* @return [X] or [ ] indicating whether the task is done and the description
* String representation of todos, marked with [T] and the desc
* helper function to display the sentence for the CLI
* @param sentence the text to be printed
// remove the last extra \n if there is at least an item in the list
